title: SameSite cookie attribute not set when tokens are splitted with Quarkus OIDC
body:
### Describe the bug

After upgrading to Quarkus we followed the advice to split the tokens to avoid issues with the max cookie size, see https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Migration-Guide-3.1#oidc

However this does not seem to set the `SameSite` attribute correctly. It is always only set on the `q_session` cookie.

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/7404187/cee9f281-acff-43c9-bd1e-a1682d81f39b)


Even if you explicitly set it to `strict` or `lax` in the config:
`quarkus.oidc.authentication.cookie-same-site=strict`

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/7404187/96dce293-be16-4b64-8c02-aa00700c3cfd)


### Expected behavior

I would expect the `SameSite` attribute to be set on all cookies

### Actual behavior

The `SameSite` attribute is only set on the `q_session` cookie

Response headers:
```
Set-Cookie:
q_auth_2e07d6ac-8792-4b9c-bf0c-79d2403557d5=; Max-Age=0; Expires=Thu, 15 Jun 2023 15:00:10 GMT; Path=/
Set-Cookie:
q_session=<token>; Max-Age=65; Expires=Thu, 15 Jun 2023 15:01:15 GMT; Path=/; HTTPOnly; SameSite=Strict
Set-Cookie:
q_session_at=<token>; Max-Age=65; Expires=Thu, 15 Jun 2023 15:01:15 GMT; Path=/; HTTPOnly
Set-Cookie:
q_session_rt=<token>; Max-Age=65; Expires=Thu, 15 Jun 2023 15:01:15 GMT; Path=/; HTTPOnly
```

### How to Reproduce?

Start a project with the Quarkus OIDC extension with the following config:

```
quarkus.oidc.application-type=hybrid

quarkus.oidc.authentication.cookie-same-site=strict

quarkus.oidc.authentication.redirect-path=/auth
quarkus.oidc.authentication.restore-path-after-redirect=true

quarkus.oidc.token-state-manager.split-tokens=true

quarkus.http.auth.permission.authenticated.paths=/*
quarkus.http.auth.permission.authenticated.policy=authenticated
```

Load the main page and inspect the cookies in your browser.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.1.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

When I inspected the cookies I also noticed that these settings were not applied to the `q_auth` cookies, but I'm also not so sure if these should have the same treatment.

```
Set-Cookie:
q_auth_2e07d6ac-8792-4b9c-bf0c-79d2403557d5=2e07d6ac-8792-4b9c-bf0c-79d2403557d5|/; Max-Age=1800; Expires=Thu, 15 Jun 2023 15:30:10 GMT; Path=/; HTTPOnly
```
